Posts.Content: Shoo foo, So glad you convinced them to not include it! I’ve had it with various chemos as well, horrible, can’t sleep more than 3 hrs first two nights following treatment. I’ve been able to get it reduced from 10 to 5mg, but they won’t let me eliminate it. Currently on pills, but maybe I’ll push a bit harder next chemo lol! Good luck to you! Nancy
Posts.Title: Dexamethasone and chemo

Posts.Content: I was on Halaven from Oct 2017 to Dec 2018. I have mets in my liver since 2010. (been on nearly everything now). The Halaven was very tolerable actually. My hair did thin out considerably & was very grey and frizzy, the neuropathy did get worse in my toes however (I do take L-Carnitine which is supposed to help against neuropathy) and just a little constipation now & then. My PET/CT in Oct 2018 showed original lesions shrinking considerably and very minimal metabolic activity-awesome result there but it also showed two new spots growing as well, had to biopsy those to confirm still breast cancer and yes,that’s what they are. Kind of weird combo of results, so I switched to Navelbine in Jan 2019 and now awaiting my next scan next week. My hair is growing in now on the Navelbine too. Good luck with the Halaven. Nancy
Posts.Title: Halaven experiences
